newsitem.title: FRANCE: IGC says no decision on Eurotunnel freight service.
newsitem.headline: IGC says no decision on Eurotunnel freight service.

text.p: The Anglo-French Intergovernmental Commission (IGC), which governs Channel Tunnel operator Eurotunnel, will not take a decision on the resumption of freight service before next week, an IGC source said on Wednesday.
Traffic of heavy goods vehicle shuttle trains was interrupted after a fire broke out in the tunnel on November 18.
"The decision to resume freight traffic service has not yet been taken," the source said, adding: "Nothing will happen before next week. They (Eurotunnel) are not yet ready."
The source said the British delegation held up the approval.
"The British delegation has some questions...(It) is following its minister," the source said.

John Prescott, deputy prime minister with responsibility for transport and the environment, has asked Eurotunnel for a precise schedule on carrying out the security committee's recommendations after the fire.
Eurotunnel had sought to resume freight traffic on May 15 and increase it gradually to reach full service by June 15.
